intro: Camolenga, commonly known as the "flower of the desert," is a rare and resilient plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has adapted to survive in extreme conditions with deep roots and a waxy leaf coating to reduce water loss. Its flowering period occurs during the brief rainy season, making it a symbol of hope in harsh environments. Camolenga is also valued for its medicinal properties, used by local communities for treating various ailments.
